Reviews.Title: “Used to be a good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave B
Reviews.Content: I used to stay here while giving technical training classes, years ago. It was always a good, clean business hotel. Now there are loud parties happening in the courtyard on weeknights, parents shouting at children at all hours and elicit drug use plainly in sight. I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: hhkexplorer
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at this hotel. Location is convenient to I-35 and downtown. The immediate surrounding area is nothing special but there are several restaurants within 5 minute drive. Check in was fast and friendly and the new courtyard bistro was good for breakfast. One of the hotel managers made a point of individually greeting everyone at breakfast - a nice, friendly touch. The rooms are somewhat small compared to other courtyards, but still comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Staff, poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: tw107
Reviews.Content: Staff was welcoming, but I thought I was in a Motel 6 based on overall quality of the hotel. Rooms are small but nicely furnished. This does not stand up to normal Courtyard standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: 0ntheroadagain
Reviews.Content: I'll admit, I almost cancelled my reservation after reading the reviews for this hotel, but very glad I didn't. We had a very nice stay - the room was clean & the staff was friendly & helpful. We had a 6am flight out of Love & the gentleman who drives the shuttle offered to come in early to get us to the airport in time - we were impressed & grateful. This hotel might not be in the most desirable part of town, but we frequented the local Walgreens, gas station & restaurant without any scary moments, :D . I have to give this hotel a "two thumbs up" - a nice overall experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price bidding Priceline..HoHum older Marriott CourtYard in East Dallas”
Reviews.Author: qwovadis
Reviews.Content: Picked this up bidding priceline.com $30 worth about that.Nice enough good beds food nearby.Staff indifferent breakfast expensive but good food within walking distance although neighborhood was dodgy.Everything except the bed seemed VERY old.OK for an overnite stop but needs much work to be once again ready for prime time.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: seahsker
Reviews.Content: We usually love Courtyard but stay away from this Hotel. First off it is located in a bad neighborhood. Dallas police had a reader board warning of bait cars in the area. We arrived to the sound of a car alarm. Turns out the truck belonged to a worker that was renovating the lobby and he was gone for the weekend. The staff was kind enough to relocate us to the other side of the hotel. Then in the middle of the night there were several young people running the halls, yelling and slamming doors. The desk clerk could not figure out how to use a gift card as partial payment.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare - if I could've slept”
Reviews.Author: crissykins
Reviews.Content: Marriotts are usually pretty nice. This one was under construction in the lobby, which is OK in itself, because the staff was courteous and got the job done. However, I am a Marriott rewards customer and my basic requests are recorded in the system. I always request a room on higher floors and away from outside doors and elevators, always request extra pillows and towels. None of those requests were met. we were put on a corner spot on the lowest level. The bed was extremely uncomfortable, and there's a "Gentleman's Club" directly behind the hotel that plays VERY loud music until all hours of the night, and you can also hear people yelling and making a lot of noise. It's right next door to a liquor store and is not in a very good part of town. The breakfast wasn't anything but bagels, muffins and cold cereal, usually they have hot breakfasts. Even though we paid in advance, we almost surrendered the room on the 2nd night and stayed with relatives. I think a Motel 6 would have been just as comfortable, or even more comfortable and a lot better price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Rebbew
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and badly in need of renovating. The price is extremely high for the poor quality, not to mention that breakfast is not included. I ran off with a box of cereal after no one was around to ring me up near the buffet. The beds were extremely thin and definitely not Marriott quality. The workout equipment has not been updated or maintained in years and should be thrown away. We checked out after 2 nights and moved to the SpringHill Suites which was next door. Fortunately, the Springhill was a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Old and needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: KathleenSarasota_FL
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is old, musty, needs new carpet and complete renovation. The mattresses are thin and the sheets are poor quality. Breakfast is not included, very limited workout room, and the business center only has a printer - no computer. The staff is friendly and helpful here, but Dallas has better choices. It is located near Pappasito's, Pappa's BBQ, and Pappadeaux, but several miles to good shopping.
